      • getKBObjectForArgument

        public static <O extends KBObjectImpl> O getKBObjectForArgument(String kboStr,
                                                Class<O> retType)
        This method wraps KBObjectFactory.get(java.lang.String, java.lang.Class) and throws IllegalArgumentException upon any KBApiException or ClassCastException.
        Type Parameters:
        O - The type of KBObject to be built
        Parameters:
        kboStr - The input string turned to a KBObject
        retType - Cast type of the returned object, same as
        Returns:
        find a KBObject and throw IllegalArgumentException if one is not found

      • minCol

        public static KBCollection minCol(Collection<KBCollection> cols,
                  Context ctx)
        Return a single minimally-general (most specific) collection among the input collections, cols in context ctx. A minimally-general collection among the input collection, is one that does not have a proper specialization among the input collections. Ties are broken by the count of KBCollection.allGeneralizations() results, which is a rough estimate of the depth of the collection in the collection hierarchy. This method wraps CreateException and KBTypeException, as a KBApiRuntimeException, these ideally should never be thrown because minCol is guaranteed to return one of the input KBCollections back. The method also wraps CycApiException and CycConnectionException, which are generally wrapped by KBApiRuntimeException.
        Parameters:
        cols - the input list of collections, among which, the most specific is found
        ctx - the context of query
        Returns:
        the minimally-general collection

      • minCol

        public static KBCollection minCol(Collection<KBCollection> cols)
        Return a single minimally-general (most specific) collection among the input collections, cols, without considering context, that is, in all contexts.
        Parameters:
        cols - the input list of collections, among which, the most specific is found
        Returns:
        the minimally-general collection
        See Also:
        for a more detailed explanation.

      • minCols

        public static Collection<KBCollection> minCols(Collection<KBCollection> cols,
                               Context ctx)
        Return all the minimally-general (most specific) collections among the input collections, cols in the context ctx. A minimally-general collection among the input collection, is one that does not have a proper specialization among the input collections. This method wraps CreateException and KBTypeException, as a KBApiRuntimeException, these ideally should never be thrown because minCol is guaranteed to return one of the input KBCollections back. The method also wraps CycApiException and CycConnectionException, which are generally wrapped by KBApiRuntimeException.
        Parameters:
        cols - the input list of collections, among which, the most specific are found
        ctx - the context of query
        Returns:
        all of the minimally-general collections

      • minCols

        public static Collection<KBCollection> minCols(Collection<KBCollection> cols)
        Return all the minimally-general (most specific) collections among the input collections, cols, without considering context, that is, in all contexts.
        Parameters:
        cols - the input list of collections, among which, the most specific are found
        Returns:

        See Also:

      • maxCols

        public static Collection<KBCollection> maxCols(Collection<KBCollection> cols,
                               Context ctx)
        Return the most general collections among the input collections, cols in the context ctx. A most general collection among the input collection, is one that does not have a proper generalization among the input collections. This method wraps CreateException and KBTypeException, as a KBApiRuntimeException, these ideally should never be thrown because minCol is guaranteed to return one of the input KBCollections back. The method also wraps CycApiException and CycConnectionException, which are generally wrapped by KBApiRuntimeException.
        Parameters:
        cols - the input list of collections, among which, the most general are found
        ctx - the context of query
        Returns:
        all of the most general collections

        Determine whether the given string termName is or is not already the name of a constant in the KB.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if the termName string is not already a constant name
